revised_title: An Account of the Dissection of an Eye with a Cataract: Exploring the Causes and Nature of Opacity
tldr: The author, John Ranby, describes the dissection of an eye with a cataract and discusses the possible causes of opacity in the crystalline humor. He explores the role of inflammation and the presence of opake particles in the lymphatic vessels, challenging the widely accepted notion of a serous acidity causing cataracts.
